faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about International Taxation

faqs.question: What is BEPS?
faqs.answer: BEPS (Base Erosion and Profit Shifting) is an OECD project to prevent multinationals from shifting profits to low or no-tax jurisdictions. It affects how profits are structured and declared worldwide.

faqs.question: How does a double taxation treaty affect me?
faqs.answer: A treaty prevents you from paying taxes on the same income in two different countries. It determines which country has the right to tax each type of income and provides mechanisms to eliminate double taxation.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to have a company in Germany to operate there?
faqs.answer: Not always, but having a German subsidiary (GmbH) greatly simplifies operations, hiring, and relationships with local clients and authorities. It is the most recommended option for a stable operation.

faqs.question: What is 'Maut'?
faqs.answer: It is the mandatory electronic toll for trucks on Germany's motorways and federal roads. Its correct management and payment are essential to avoid penalties.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Management in Spain

faqs.question: What is IGIC?
faqs.answer: The IGIC (Canary Islands General Indirect Tax) is the tax equivalent to VAT that applies in the Canary Islands, with different tax rates and specific management.

faqs.question: Do I need the ROI if I only sell digital services?
faqs.answer: Yes, if you provide or acquire services from companies in other European Union countries, you need to be registered in the ROI so that invoices are issued correctly without VAT (with reverse charge mechanism).

faqs.answer: No. Travel insurance covers emergencies for a short period. Expat health insurance offers complete, long-term medical coverage, similar to social security, but on an international level.
